com.dooapp.gaedo.blueprints.transformers
Class SerializableTransformer

java.lang.Object
  com.dooapp.gaedo.blueprints.transformers.SerializableTransformer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Transformer, TupleTransformer<Serializable>
public class SerializableTransformer
extends Object
implements TupleTransformer<Serializable>

Serializable handling is quite particular. Instead of saving a simple node type, this transformer checks the contained value and try to save it according to its inner type (using LiteralTransformer, others TupleTransformer and services). This provide compact DB with good performances, at the cost of a complex class ... this one.

Author:
ndx

Method Detail

getVertexFor

public <DataType> com.tinkerpop.blueprints.pgm.Vertex getVertexFor(AbstractBluePrintsBackedFinderService<? extends com.tinkerpop.blueprints.pgm.Graph,DataType,?> service,
                                                                   Serializable cast,
                                                                   javax.persistence.CascadeType cascade,
                                                                   Map<String,Object> objectsBeingUpdated)
Get vertex for the value. To get that vertex, we first check the effective value type. If a literal or a tuple (other than serializable), we use that vertex value. If a managed object, we use the service associated to that object. Finally, if an unknown serializable ... well, we serialize it

Specified by:
getVertexFor in interface TupleTransformer<Serializable>

loadObject

public Object loadObject(GraphDatabaseDriver driver,
                         GraphMappingStrategy strategy,
                         ClassLoader classLoader,
                         Class effectiveClass,
                         com.tinkerpop.blueprints.pgm.Vertex key,
                         com.dooapp.gaedo.finders.repository.ServiceRepository repository,
                         Map<String,Object> objectsBeingAccessed)
For loading object, reverse job iof persisting is done, but way simpler, as using other persistences mechanisms allows us to load known serializable using their assocaited literal transformers/services, which is WAAAAYYYYYYY cooler. So, this method simple job is just to read value and deserialize it. Nice, no ?
